intro: Polyscias harmsii, commonly known as the Hawaiian nettle or green nettle, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves with a distinctive net-like venation. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are usually greenish-white and appear in clusters. Polyscias harmsii is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
